intro: Drapetes dieffenbachii var. laxa, commonly known as the slender drapetis, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, moist climate. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
